txt.en: 'My lady, I grow concerned about the morale of the people of Edoras.'
'It is as you say, Lady Éowyn. We vow to do everything in our power to leave as soon as possible.'
'They were happy to see the king ride, but he is gone, and a dreariness has settled upon the folk once more.'
'Thank you all. And good luck to you.'
'We... we must endeavour to keep our spirits up.'
Éowyn's Quarters
'Times of war are hard indeed.'
Edoras
Britred
Théolac
Léodferth
'We haven't long before we must depart our city.'
'Do not trouble yourself with cares over silver or gold; glad will I be if the people of Edoras arrive at Dunharrow whole and hale.'
'These are troubled times, and surely you have many cares.'
'Lady Éowyn, I fear that there will be many problems with moving so many people across the plains....'
'My lady, people are desperately afraid of going hungry if they leave Edoras.'
'Most of our folk have no horses, no carts. We will go slowly and encounter many troubles along the way.'
'The farmers must abandon their crops, and they believe they will starve.'
'It will not be easy, but war is upon us, and King Théoden has given his command.'
'Fear not, Léodferth. Dunharrow is well-stocked.'
'We must walk to Dunharrow, with or without the supplies we need.'
'I swear to you now that the House of Eorl will not see its people starve whilst it stands.'
'The safe arrival of my people is the only matter of importance, but we will do our best to prepare!'
